content.user_title: Design Better AI Prompts with Structured Framework
content.value_statement: Poor prompts produce inconsistent AI responses. This framework provides systematic methods to analyze, refine, and optimize prompts using evidence-based techniques. Build prompts that consistently deliver high-quality outputs.
actual_capabilities: Analyze prompts across intent, structure, context, and technique dimensions
Apply evidence-based techniques including self-consistency and chain-of-thought
Detect and fix common anti-patterns like vague instructions and missing edge cases
Optimize prompt structure using hierarchical organization and delimiter strategies
Adapt prompts for specific AI models including Claude and ChatGPT
limitations: Provides guidance and frameworks only, does not execute or test prompts
Does not generate prompts automatically from requirements
Requires user to apply the methodology manually
Effectiveness depends on user understanding and iteration

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this prompt for issues: [paste prompt]. Evaluate clarity, structure, context, and technique application. Identify specific problems and suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Create Prompt
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an optimized prompt for [task description]. Apply evidence-based techniques appropriate for [task type]. Include context, constraints, and output format.

prompt_templates.title: Add Techniques
prompt_templates.prompt: Enhance this prompt using [self-consistency | plan-and-solve | few-shot] technique. Show the original prompt and the enhanced version with explanations.

prompt_templates.title: Fix Anti-Patterns
prompt_templates.prompt: Diagnose why this prompt produces poor results: [paste prompt]. Identify anti-patterns causing issues and provide corrected version.

output_examples.input: Analyze this prompt: Write good product descriptions for our store.
output: Clarity: Vague action verb 'write' without specifying style, length, or audience
Context missing: No product details, brand voice, or target customer defined
Anti-patterns: Vague instructions, assumed knowledge, missing success criteria
Recommendation: Specify product details, desired length (100-150 words), brand voice guidelines, and key points to include

best_practices: Test prompts empirically and iterate based on actual performance, not theoretical optimization
Make all context and assumptions explicit rather than assuming shared understanding
Match prompting technique sophistication to task complexity using frameworks like self-consistency for analytical tasks
anti_patterns: Using vague instructions like 'analyze this' without specifying analysis criteria or purpose
Burying critical requirements in the middle of long prompts instead of positioning at beginning and end
Neglecting edge cases by not specifying handling for empty inputs, errors, or boundary conditions

faq.question: Which AI models work with this framework?
faq.answer: Applies to all major models including Claude, ChatGPT, Gemini, and Codex. Techniques adapt to model strengths.

faq.question: How long should prompts be?
faq.answer: Short prompts (under 200 words) work for simple tasks. Complex prompts benefit from hierarchical structure.

faq.question: Does this integrate with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, use the framework when designing prompts for Claude Code workflows and automated agent interactions.

faq.question: Is my prompt data stored?
faq.answer: No, this is a guidance framework only. No prompts are transmitted, stored, or processed externally.

faq.question: Why is my prompt producing bad results?
faq.answer: Common causes: vague instructions, missing context, conflicting requirements, or wrong technique for task type.

faq.question: How is this different from basic prompt tips?
faq.answer: Provides systematic methodology with evidence-based techniques, anti-pattern detection, and structural optimization principles.
